content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

To define a custom `Show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct in Julia, you can use the following code:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fwu.value, " ", fwu.unit)
end
```

Now, when you create an instance of `FloatWithUnits` and call `display` or print it to the console, it will show the value followed by a space and then the unit string. For example:

```julia
julia> FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
1.8 meters
```

Please note that the `Show` method uses the default printer (`print()`) to print both fields of the struct. If you want to use a different separator or formatting, you can do so by changing the string passed to `print()`.
